intro: Tithymalus altissimus, commonly known as the tall tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems that can grow up to 1.5 meters in height. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of the Apiaceae family. Tithymalus altissimus is native to Central Asia and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
